name: Best Rolls Ever!
author: Cara A. Austin
summary: A yeast-roll recipe which uses self-rising flour for the most airy, delicious rolls ever! Note: the secret to these light and airy rolls is NOT punching down the dough and NOT kneading it, plus the added lift the self-rising flour gives.
directions: In a large bowl place 2 cups water and butter or margarine
In another bowl, mix 1 cup sugar and eggs
In a separate cup, microwave 1/2 cup water for 30 seconds
Add 1 teaspoon sugar and dissolve yeast in this
Mix butter water and sugar and eggs mixture together; add salt
Mix well and let rise in the refrigerator overnight, covered
When ready to use, dump onto floured surface (DO NOT PUNCH DOWN!) and let warm to room temperature
LIGHTLY KNEAD! Only work in enough extra flour to handle
Shape into rolls and place on greased sheet(s)
Let rest 30 minutes, or until doubled in size
Bake in a preheated 400 degree F (205 degrees C) oven until tops are golden
Brush with oil or butter immediately out of the oven
